summary: App to create a personalized surprise by entering a girlfriend's name and a custom message, then showing an animation of a teddy bear eating chocolate.
architectural_notes: Animation polish request: add more detail to the teddy bear eating chocolate sequence (beyond current anime-style motion improvements).
known_issues: Teddy bear animation: chocolate inside the teddy's hands is missing/does not render.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page flow where the user can enter their girlfriend’s name and a custom message, then tap a clear call-to-action (e.g., “Surprise”) to reveal the personalized surprise view displaying the entered name and message.

Implement an on-screen animation sequence of a teddy bear eating chocolate that plays on the surprise view and is visually tied to the personalized message reveal (e.g., message appears with a timed fade/slide while the teddy animation runs).
Apply a coherent, romantic visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and components) suitable for a “surprise for girlfriend” experience, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.

Add generated static image assets needed for the teddy-and-chocolate animation and render them from frontend static assets (do not serve images from the backend). Place generated assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use those files in the animation.

Update the teddy bear eating chocolate animation to feel like an anime character eating chocolate by adding more expressive motion (e.g., head bob + squash-and-stretch, blinking/eye highlights, mouth open/chew cycle, and snappier timing) while keeping the animation tied to the surprise reveal experience.

Enhance the animation visuals using additional static overlays/frames (served from frontend static assets) to support the anime feel (e.g., speed lines, sparkle highlights, and chew frames) and integrate them into the existing TeddyChocolateAnimation component sequence.
Add eating sound effects to the teddy bear eating chocolate animation, with bite/chew sounds timed to the existing animation phases (bite + each mouth open/close chew beat).
Provide a simple user control to mute/unmute animation sound effects on the Surprise view, and ensure sound only starts after a user interaction that triggers the Surprise/Replay flow.

Increase the visual detail of the teddy bear eating chocolate animation by adding additional micro-actions and/or overlays (e.g., stronger head bob/squash-and-stretch during bite impact, subtle shake on crumbs, extra sparkle/impact accent) while keeping the current multi-phase structure (idle/anticipation/bite/chew/satisfied).

Correct the teddy-eating-chocolate animation so the chocolate bar is clearly visible inside/between the teddy’s hands (not missing/hidden) throughout the early phases, while keeping the rest of the animation and visuals unchanged.

Improve the teddy bear eating chocolate animation to feel more like an anime character eating chocolate (more expressive/anime-style motion)

projectName: Personalized surprise page with name + message and teddy bear chocolate animation
